title: How to Add One Line to Make 200: Answer Revealed

steps.title: Write a 100 on a blank sheet of paper.
steps.content: Write a 100 on a blank sheet of paper.

steps.title: Write another 100 directly below the first 100.
steps.content: Write another 100 directly below the first 100. Make sure both digits are equally spaced and aligned. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Draw one short straight line on the top-left “1” to create a “T.”
steps.content: Draw one short straight line on the top-left “1” to create a “T.” Your new equation should look like "T00 100." [2] X Research source

steps.title: Write 188 on a blank sheet of paper.
steps.content: Write 188 on a blank sheet of paper.

steps.title: Draw one straight horizontal line directly through the middle of 188.
steps.content: Draw one straight horizontal line directly through the middle of 188. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Look at the numbers above and below the horizontal line.
steps.content: Look at the numbers above and below the horizontal line. By dividing the 188 into 2 parts, it turns into a 100 on top and a 100 on the bottom (100+100=200).

steps.title: Write the Roman numeral 9 (“IX”) on a blank sheet of paper.
steps.content: Write the Roman numeral 9 (“IX”) on a blank sheet of paper. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Draw an “S” at the beginning of “IX.”
steps.content: Draw an “S” at the beginning of “IX.” [5] X Research source

steps.title: Read the new expression.
steps.content: Read the new expression. With the single line you added, your 9 ("IX") equals a 6 ("SIX").

steps.title: Write down "5+5+5+5=555" on a blank sheet of paper.
steps.content: Write down "5+5+5+5=555" on a blank sheet of paper.

steps.title: Draw a short straight line to connect the top of the first addition sign to its left side.
steps.content: Draw a short straight line to connect the top of the first addition sign to its left side. This transforms the addition sign into a “4” shape. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Add up your new equation.
steps.content: Add up your new equation. Since you transformed the first addition sign into a “4,” your new equation reads “545+5+5=555.” [7] X Research source
